intro: Asyneuma limonifolium subsp. psaridis, commonly known as the lemon-leaf asyneuma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lemon-scented leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers are small and yellow, often grouped into clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
